intro: Lavatera lusitanica, commonly known as the Portuguese hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, rose-like flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Lavatera lusitanica is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and can thrive in well-drained soil with full sun.
